CatDescriptText: Mrs. Robert Parrish, 319 Logan Street, Sewickley, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "I would say whites. And I might add that I know of several cases where people who need public assistance cannot receive it.  As for who cheats the most, I will say that I've found out that the colored race will go a long way before they start to try to get something for nothing.  This is not true with the other race."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Robert Parrish wearing light colored hat with netting, earrings, scarf, button down coat, and light colored gloves, standing next to man and boy in front of Jenkins Arcade, on Liberty Avenue with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
